column2: MONTANA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
2. An orange-colored sign means:
3. This sign warns that:
column6: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 4. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.

column2: 5. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 6. Distracted driving may be caused by _________ while driving.
7. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column2: 8. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 9. This sign indicates:
column8: Do not use your phone while driving

column2: 10. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 11. How many drinks of alcohol does the human body generally get rid of each hour?
12. This road sign means:
13. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column6: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column8: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column10: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.

column2: 14. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column6: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column10: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

column2: 15. A flashing red light:
column6: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.
column8: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 16. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 17. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column6: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column8: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column10: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 19. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
20. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 21. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
22. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 23. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column6: be alert and obey all traffic signals.
column8: look both ways before crossing the tracks.

column2: 24. In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction as you are going:
column6: whenever you have the opportunity to do so.
column10: only if the other driver signals it is safe.

column2: 25. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 26. BAC is:
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column10: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 27. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column6: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column10: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column2: 28. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column6: look into the right side mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column10: look into the left side mirror.

column2: 29. This road sign is:
30. It is illegal to drive below the speed limit:
column8: when driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 31. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
32. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
33. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column8: A left turn can be made only after stopping
